parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.58
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns the direction unit is looking in render time scope. While for AI the origin for the view direction vector can be taken from <tt>[[eyePos]] unit</tt>, for human player the origin should be taken from player camera position <tt>[[positionCameraToWorld]] [0,0,0]</tt>

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''getCameraViewDirection''' unit

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - 3D Vector

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> Draw AI eye direction (green), weapon direction (red) and camera direction (blue) in 3D: <code>bob = [[createGroup]] [[east]] [[createUnit]] ["O_Soldier_F", [0,0,0], [], 0, "NONE"];
bob [[setVehiclePosition]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[player]] [[modelToWorld]] [0,100,0], [], 0, "NONE"];
[[onEachFrame]]
{
	_beg = [[ASLToAGL]] [[eyePos]] bob;
	_endE = (_beg [[vectorAdd]] ([[eyeDirection]] bob [[vectorMultiply]] 100));
	[[drawLine3D]] [ _beg, _endE, [0,1,0,1]];
	_endW = (_beg [[vectorAdd]] (bob [[weaponDirection]] [[currentWeapon]] bob [[vectorMultiply]] 100));
	[[drawLine3D]] [_beg, _endW, [1,0,0,1]];
	_endV = (_beg [[vectorAdd]] ([[getCameraViewDirection]] bob [[vectorMultiply]] 100));
	[[drawLine3D]] [_beg, _endV, [0,0,1,1]];
};</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[positionCameraToWorld]], [[weaponDirection]], [[eyeDirection]], [[vectorDir]], [[vectorDirVisual]]
</value></part></template></root>
